responsibilities: Collaborate with product and technical leaders to identify customer problems, scope requirements, and implement solutions.
Build and maintain full-stack systems, end-to-end, from user interfaces to backend services, ensuring high availability, scalability, and performance.
Develop metrics and observability to enable the launch, maintenance, and continuous improvement of systems and features.
Stay on top of current industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously evolve the tech stack and development processes.
Participate in code reviews, mentor teammates, and help to define engineering practices.
Contribute to building a world-class engineering team through recruiting and mentorship.
skills: Strong background in both front-end and back-end technologies.
Experience in building scalable, high-performance systems that can handle large amounts of data and traffic.
Excitement about Large Language Models (LLMs) and the opportunity to build systems that support and leverage them.
Ability to quickly ramp up on a tech stack that includes TypeScript, React, Next.js, Node.js, Apollo GraphQL, and Aurora PostgreSQL.
Ability to independently drive projects with ambiguous problems and deliver results.
Ability to balance an ambitious vision with frequent, meaningful user value delivery.
Clear communication skills for reasoning and decision-making with both technical and nontechnical teammates.
Energized by building software experiences that customers will use directly and depend on.
analysis:
The job description provided focuses on building and maintaining full-stack systems, collaborating with product and technical leaders, developing metrics, staying updated with industry trends, participating in code reviews, and contributing to team building. The skills required include a strong background in front-end and back-end technologies, experience with scalable systems, excitement about LLMs, and proficiency in a tech stack that includes TypeScript, React, Next.js, Node.js, Apollo GraphQL, and Aurora PostgreSQL.

1. **AI Research Scientist**: This option focuses on AI methodologies, experiments, and model evaluation, which does not align with the full-stack development and system building focus of the job.

2. **AI/ML Engineer**: This role is about transforming research into AI solutions, which is not the primary focus of the job described.

3. **MLOps / AI Infrastructure Engineer**: This role focuses on AI system deployment and monitoring, which is not aligned with the full-stack development and system building focus of the job.

4. **AI Solution Architect**: This role involves designing AI solutions and collaborating on AI use cases, which is not the primary focus of the job described.

5. **Data Scientist**: This role focuses on data analysis and model development, which does not align with the full-stack development and system building focus of the job.

6. **Data Engineer**: This role involves data pipeline and architecture development, which is not aligned with the full-stack development and system building focus of the job.

7. **Product Manager**: This role focuses on product vision and strategy, which is not aligned with the full-stack development and system building focus of the job.

8. **Software Engineer**: This option aligns well with the job description. It involves designing, developing, and maintaining software applications, collaborating with cross-functional teams, writing clean code, participating in system architecture discussions, and improving system performance. The skills required, such as proficiency in programming languages, experience with modern frameworks, and understanding of software design principles, match the job's requirements.

The job description is most similar to the "Software Engineer" option, as both focus on full-stack development, system building, and collaboration with cross-functional teams.
